meanings.definition: The basic unit of length in the metric system, equal to 100 centimetres.
meanings.sent1: The football field measured 100 metres in length.
meanings.sent2: The sign indicated that the distance to the park was 200 metres.
meanings.sent3: I tried to jump 100 metres in one go, but I only made it halfway!
meanings.sent4: Her patience stretched for what felt like a million metres during the long wait.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a rope that was exactly 1 metre long to demonstrate the measurement.

meanings.definition: A metric unit of measurement equal to 3.28 feet.
meanings.sent1: The construction worker measured the beam to be 5 metres long.
meanings.sent2: The marathon course was marked every 500 metres for the runners.
meanings.sent3: The cat walked a few metres, then decided to take a nap in the sun.
meanings.sent4: His determination to finish the race was like running a thousand metres without stopping.
meanings.sent5: The road sign warned of a sharp turn ahead, just a few metres away.
